title: Bushehr
content: Along the coasts of the Persian Gulf, there are a variety of erosion phenomena is. Much climatic humidity, high temperature, diversity of the materials in formations, and ground motions have created such erosion types. A rare erosion is on the south edge of Nar Anticline near Jam city in Bushehr province, which has occurred in the shape of a quadrangular sheet in Daryan Fahlyan (Early Cretaceous) limy formation. This big quadrangle is about 450m long and 150m wide. This phenomenon is similar to a small mass that has slid down in the Seymar√© landslide.

gallery.caption: ER16-1 :A scenic erosional phenomenon having the form of a quadrangle sheet

ER16-3 :Very scenic forms of erosion in the erodible formations along the Persian Gulf coast near Delvar
